result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler P Stoltenberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: ***AMENDED*** 9-07-16  Costs were assessed per the Court's directive after the hearing.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Tyler P Stoltenberg
Current: 2000 E Winnebago Street, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 12-21-2016)
Prior: 403 Jackson St, Columbia County Jail, Portage, WI 53901 United States
defendant requests restitution and courts costs be deducted from prison wages only
Sept. 6, 2016 sentencing after revocation - Court Reporter Chris Champeau
Filed by Atty Roger Klopp

Defendant Tyler P Stoltenberg in court, in custody with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 16CF47, 15CF95 and 11CF358.  Defendants mother made statement to the Court.  Sentencing recommendations argued by Counsel.  Exhibit #1 offered by attorney Klopp (copy of lab report).  Agent Champion made a statement to Court about the defendant at Courts request.  In 11CF358 Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 years in prison.  4 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision.  933 days credit.  Defendant is eligible for the challenge Incarceration Program and substance abuse program. In 15CF95 Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 years in prison.  2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.  Consecutive to 11CF358. Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.   No credit.  In 16CF47 Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 year in jail, concurrent to all prior sentences.  No jail credit.  11:11/12:00
Sentencing hearing on September 6, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Filed by Atty Roger Klopp

Cases called: 16CF47 & 15CF95, Defendant Tyler P Stoltenberg in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 3 in 16CF47 and count 1 in 15CF95. Court found defendant guilty. Counts 1&2 in 16CF47 read in and dismissed.  Pre-sentence Investigation ordered, to be completed within 60 days. Bonds revoked in both cases. Upon receipt, argued sentencing to be set.
